CreateHubCluster.summary: Creates a master instance in Alibaba Cloud Distributed Cloud Container Platform (ACK One).

schema.description: The ID of the region. You can call the DescribeRegions operation to query available regions.
The ID of the virtual private cloud (VPC) to which the master instance belongs. You can call the DescribeVpcs operation to query available VPCs.

Specifies whether to expose the API server to the Internet. Valid values:

*   true: exposes the API server to the Internet.
*   false: exposes the API server to the internal network.

schema.title: 集群名称
schema.description: The name of the master instance.
The ID of the vSwitch.

Specifies whether to enable the audit log feature. Valid values:

*   true: enables the audit log feature.
*   false: disables the audit log feature.

schema.title: 是否企业安全组
schema.description: Specifies whether to use an advanced security group.

schema.title: 集群配置
schema.description:
The type of scenario for which the master instance is suitable. Valid values:

*   `Default`: The master instance is suitable for standard scenarios.
*   `XFlow`: The master instance is suitable for workflow scenarios.

Default value: `Default`.

Specifies whether to enable the workflow instance UI. This parameter takes effect only if Profile is set to XFlow. Valid values:

*   true
*   false

The scheduling mode of the workflow. This parameter takes effect only if Profile is set to XFlow. Valid values:

*   cost-optimized: cost-prioritized scheduling mode.
*   stock-optimized: inventory-prioritized scheduling mode.
The limit on the prices of containers in the workflow. This parameter takes effect only if the WorkflowScheduleMode parameter is set to cost-optimized.
The Resource Group ID.

The tags.

You can specify at most 20 tags in each call.

items.description: The list of tags.

ClusterId.description: The ID of the master instance.

CreateHubCluster.title: CreateHubCluster

DescribeHubClusters.summary: Queries the Fleet instances in the Distributed Cloud Container Platform for Kubernetes (ACK One) cluster.

schema.description:
The types of Fleet instances used in different scenarios. Valid values:

*   `Default`: The Fleet instances suitable for standard scenarios.
*   `XFlow`: The Fleet instance suitable for workflow scenarios.

Default value: `Default`.
The resource group ID.
The tags. You can specify up to 20 tags.

items.description: The tag.

schema.description: The response parameters.

items.description: The cluster information.

IntranetApiServerEndpoint.description: The internal endpoint of the API server.

PublicApiServerEndpoint.description: The public endpoint of the API server.

CreationTime.description: The time when the cluster was created.

UpdateTime.description: The time when the cluster was last modified.

ErrorMessage.description: The error message that is returned if the cluster failed to be created.

State.description:
The state of the cluster. Valid values:

*   initial: The cluster is being initialized.
*   failed: The cluster failed to be created.
*   running: The cluster is running
*   inactive: The cluster is not activated.
*   deleting: The cluster is being deleted.
*   delete_failed: The cluster failed to be deleted.
*   deleted: The cluster is deleted.

ClusterSpec.description:
The specifications of the cluster.

*   Only ack.pro.small may be returned.

items.description: The tag.

Network.description: The network configurations of the cluster.

VpcId.description: The ID of the virtual private cloud (VPC) to which the cluster belongs.

VSwitches.description: The IDs of vSwitches to which the cluster belongs.

items.description: The vSwitch ID.
The security group ID.

ClusterDomain.description: The domain name of the cluster.

ApiServer.description: The information about the API server.

EnabledPublic.description:
Indicates whether the public endpoint is enabled for the API server. Valid values:

*   true
*   false

LoadBalancerId.description: The ID of the Server Load Balancer (SLB) instance that is associated with the cluster.

MeshConfig.description: The configurations of Alibaba Cloud Service Mesh (ASM).

EnableMesh.description:
Indicates whether ASM is enabled. Valid values:

*   true
*   false

EnableLog.description:
Indicates whether the audit logging feature is enabled. Valid values:

*   true
*   false

LogProject.description: The name of the project in Simple Log Service.

LogStoreTTL.description: The number of days that logs are retained by Simple Log Service.

Conditions.description: The deletion conditions of the cluster.

items.description: The details of the condition.

Status.description:
The state of the cluster that the deletion condition indicates. Valid values:

*   True: The cluster cannot be deleted.
*   False: The cluster can be deleted.
*   Unknow: Whether the cluster can be deleted is unknown.

Reason.description: The reason for the deletion condition.

DeleteHubCluster.summary: Deletes a master cluster in Alibaba Cloud Distributed Cloud Container Platform (ACK One).

schema.description: The ID of the master instance.

Specifies whether to forcefully delete the master instance in ACK One. Valid values:

*   true: forcefully deletes the master instance in ACK One.
*   false: does not forcibly delete the master instance in ACK One.

Default value: false.
The list of resources to retain.

items.description: A JSON string that can be parsed into a string array. You can use this JSON string to specify the IDs of the resource instances that need to be retained when the master instance is deleted.

The name of the master instance. The name must be 1 to 63 characters in length. It must start with a letter, and can contain letters, digits, underscores (\_), and hyphens (-).

*   false: disables the audit logging feature.

Specifies whether to enable Service Mesh (ASM). Valid values:

*   true
*   false

Default value: false.

Specifies whether to associate an elastic IP address (EIP) with the API server. Valid values:

*   true: associates an EIP with the API server. You can specify ApiServerEipId. If you do not specify ApiServerEipId, the system automatically creates an EIP.
*   false: disassociates an EIP from the API server.
The ID of the EIP.

Specifies whether to enable Argo CD. This parameter takes effect only if Profile is set to XFlow. Valid values:

*   false

Specifies whether to enable the workflow instance UI. This parameter takes effect only if Profile is set to XFlow. Valid values:

*   true
*   false

The scheduling mode of the workflow. This parameter takes effect only if Profile is set to XFlow. Valid values:

*   cost-optimized: cost-prioritized scheduling mode.
*   stock-optimized: inventory-prioritized scheduling mode.
The limit on the prices of containers in the workflow. This parameter takes effect only if the WorkflowScheduleMode parameter is set to cost-optimized.
The vSwitches.

DescribeUserPermissions.summary: Query the permissions of a Resource Access Management (RAM) user.

schema.description: The ID of the RAM user that you want to query.

schema.title: Schema of Response
schema.description: Schema of Response

Permissions.description: The details about the permissions of the RAM user.

items.description: The details about the permissions of the RAM user.

RoleType.description:
The type of predefined role. Valid values:

*   admin: administrator
*   dev: developer

RoleName.description: The name of the custom role. If a custom role is assigned, the value is the name of the assigned custom role.

ResourceType.description:
The authorization type. Valid values:

*   cluster: indicates that the permissions are scoped to a cluster.
*   namespace: indicates that the permissions are scoped to a namespace of a cluster.

ResourceId.description:
The authorization setting. Valid values:

*   {cluster_id} is returned if the permissions are scoped to a cluster.
*   {cluster_id}/{namespace} is returned if the permissions are scoped to a namespace of a cluster.
*   all-clusters is returned if the permissions are scoped to all clusters.

DescribeUserPermissions.title: DescribeUserPermissions

DescribeHubClusterKubeconfig.summary: Queries the kubeconfig file of a Distributed Cloud Container Platform for Kubernetes (ACK One) cluster. In addition to the Container Service for Kubernetes (ACK) console, you can also use the Kubernetes CLI kubectl to manage clusters and applications. If you use kubectl to manage an ACK cluster, you must obtain the kubeconfig file of the cluster and use kubectl to connect to the cluster.

schema.description: The cluster ID.

Specifies whether to obtain the kubeconfig file that is used to connect to the cluster over the internal network. Valid values:

*   `true`: obtains the kubeconfig file that is used to connect to the master instance over the internal network.
*   `false`: obtains the kubeconfig file that is used to connect to the master instance over the Internet.

Default value: `false`

Kubeconfig.description: The content of the kubeconfig file.
Kubeconfig.example:
"
apiVersion: v1
clusters:
- cluster:
    server: https://172.16.11.***:6443
    certificate-authority-data: LS0tLS1CRU=...
  name: kubernetes
contexts:
- context:
    cluster: kubernetes
    user: "kubernetes-a****"
  name: kubernetes-admin-cc2cbf5802bec4bfa9fae4014d8c****
current-context: kubernetes-admin-cc2cbf5802bec4bfa9fae4014d8c9****
kind: Config
preferences: {}
users:
- name: "kubernetes-admin"
  user:
    client-certificate-data: LS0tLS1CRU...
    client-key-data: LS0tCg==...
"

DescribeHubClusterKubeconfig.title: DescribeHubClusterKubeconfig

GrantUserPermission.summary: Grants role-based access control (RBAC) permissions to Resource Access Management (RAM) users or RAM roles. System policies can be attached to RAM users to grant only the operation permissions on Distributed Cloud Container Platform for Kubernetes (ACK One) cluster resources. The operation permissions include creating and viewing instances. If you want to perform operations on Kubernetes resources in a specific cluster by using a RAM user or assuming a RAM role, such as creating GitOps applications and Argo workflows, you must grant RBAC permissions to the RAM user or RAM role to perform operations on the specified ACK One cluster and namespace. This topic describes how to grant RBAC permissions to a RAM user or RAM role.

schema.description:
The authorization type. Valid values:

*   cluster: The permissions are granted to a cluster.
*   namespace: The permissions are granted to a namespace of a cluster.

The predefined role. Valid values:

*   admin: administrator
*   dev: developer
*   gitops-dev: GitOps developer. The parameter is available only for Fleet instances.

The value of RoleName and that of RoleType must meet the following requirements:

*   If **RoleType** is set to **cluster**, this parameter must be set to **admin**.
*   If **RoleType** is set to **namespace**, this parameter must be set to **dev** or **gitops-dev**.
The cluster ID.

The name of the namespace.

*   If **RoleType** is set to **cluster**, you do not need to specify this parameter.
*   This parameter is required if **RoleType** is set to **namespace**.
*   If **RoleType** is set to **namespace** and **RoleName** is set to **gitops-dev**, this parameter is required and must be set to **argocd**.
The ID of the RAM user or RAM role.

The entity to which the permissions are granted. A value of `true` indicates that the permissions are granted to a RAM user. A value of `false` indicates that the permissions are granted to a RAM role.

schema.title: Schema of Response
schema.description: Schema of Response

GrantUserPermission.title: GrantUserPermission
GrantUserPermission.description:
*   To call this API operation to grant permissions to a RAM user or RAM role on a specific cluster, you must use an Alibaba Cloud account, the account that is used to create the cluster, or a RAM user that has the cluster administrator permissions. A regular RAM user does not have the permissions to call this operation.
*   Before you grant RBAC permissions to a RAM user or RAM role on a cluster, you must grant the operation permissions to the RAM user or RAM role on the specified cluster. For more information, see [Attach a system permission policy to a RAM user or RAM role](~~613486~~).

For more information, see [Authorization overview](~~613468~~).

UpdateUserPermission.summary: Updates the role-based access control (RBAC) permissions of a RAM user.

schema.description:
The authorization type. Valid values:

*   cluster: specifies that the permissions are scoped to a master instance.
*   namespace: specifies that the permissions are scoped to a namespace of a cluster.

The predefined role. Valid values:

*   admin: administrator
*   dev: developer
The ID of the master instance.
The namespace to which the permissions are scoped. By default, this parameter is empty when you set RoleType to cluster.
The ID of the RAM user.

schema.title: Schema of Response
schema.description: Schema of Response

UpdateUserPermission.title: UpdateUserPermission

The number of deployments that match the policies in the associated cluster, including deployments that are blocked and deployments that have triggered alerting. The deployments are classified by policy type.

Deny.description: The information about the deployments that are blocked.

items.description: The information about the deployments that are blocked.

PolicyDescription.example: Restricts secrets used in pod envs

Severity.description: The severity level of the policy.

Violations.description: The number of times that the policy blocks deployments.

Warn.description: The information about the deployments that have triggered alerting.

items.description: The information about the deployments that have triggered alerting.

PolicyDescription.example: Restricts secrets used in pod envs

Severity.description: The severity level of the policy.

Violations.description: The number of times that the policy generates alerts.

DeletePolicyInstance.summary: Deletes a policy for associated clusters.

schema.description: The ID of the master instance.
The name of the policy.
A array of JSON strings. The JSON strings in the array indicate the IDs of the associated clusters for which the policy is deleted.

items.description: A JSON string. The JSON string indicates the ID of the associated cluster for which the policy is deleted.

DescribeHubClusterLogs.summary: Queries the logs of the Fleet instance of a multi-cluster fleet of Distributed Cloud Container Platform for Kubernetes (ACK One).

schema.title: 集群ID
schema.description: The ID of the Fleet instance. You can call the [DescribeHubClusters](~~424404~~) operation to query the created Fleet instances.

schema.title: Schema of Response
schema.description: The response parameters.

items.description: The content of the log entry.

CreationTime.description: The time when the log was created. The time follows the ISO 8601 standard in the *yyyy-MM-dd*T*HH:mm:ss*Z format. The time is displayed in UTC.

ClusterId.description: The ID of the Fleet instance.

ClusterLog.description: The log of the Fleet instance.

LogLevel.description:
The log level. Valid values:

*   error
*   warn
*   info
